alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 9:12AM EDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Dickinson, Iron, Forest and Florence Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Brule River near Commonwealth. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Floodwaters approach seasonal homes off Runbers Road in Florence County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM CDT Friday was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 04/25/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
